result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra J Goodlad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cassandra J Goodlad in court with attorney Chris Bailey.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 4.
All other counts are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
235 Days Credit.
Consecutive to: case:  15CM1043
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Mental Health assessment and follow through.
Compliance with all mental health treatment and medications.
Defendant to sign a medical release for agent.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail and Refund any balance to the posting party.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Cassandra J Goodlad in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State presents statements regarding the competency report. Defense counsel is in agreement with the findings of the competency report. Court makes findings and the cases are reinstated as the defendant has been found competent. Defense counsel presents arguments regarding the bail. State objects to any bail modification. Court grants the bail modification.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
filed, to be produced from Winnebago Mental Health Institute

Report of Kelli L. Douville, Ph.D. dated 1/21/16

Original retained in file 15CM794
Review hearing at 01-27-2016 01:30 pm
Order of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant Cassandra J Goodlad in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Christina Engen testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by attorney Smith. State presents closing arguments and agrees with Mr. Engen that the defendant be found incompetent. Defense presents closing arguments. Court does find the defendant incompetent and she is remanded to HHS (Winnebago) for treatment, court further finds that the defendant is incompetent to refuse medications.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
